entries.content:
Starting new session with Moti. Refreshed context on Semantix project:
- VSCode extension for visual Claude Code/Qwen experience
- Recent work: Fixed permission dialog bug (UI field mapping + ResultTransformer data loss)
- Multi-state architecture working well (permission + agent state tracks)
- Rich permission dialogs with full metadata
- Real-time streaming with thinking indicators
- Ready to tackle next challenge!

Switched context to Semantix logo animation project in tests/design/semantix-logo-animation/
Current state: Ultra-modular animation system with dynamic grids (2×2 to 8×8), flash/fade controllers, orchestrator pattern, CSS keyframes
Architecture: SemantixLogoOrchestrator → CubeGridManager → SemantixCube, with independent CubeFlashController and CubeFadeController
Ready to add next feature from future_planning list!

Feature request: Make animations continue seamlessly when grid size changes instead of resetting. Currently setGridSize() stops all animations, regenerates SVG, then restarts - losing animation state and timing.

Implemented seamless animation continuation on grid size changes:
- Added continue() methods to both CubeFlashController and CubeFadeController
- Modified setGridSize() to track which animations were running individually
- Now calls continue() instead of start() to avoid jarring restart
- New cubes immediately join ongoing animations without reset
Added Anime.js CDN to index.html for advanced animations. Using ES module import from jsdelivr CDN. Made anime globally available via window.anime for use in all modules.
Refactoring: Removing current CSS-based animations (flash/fade) to rebuild with Anime.js. Creating animations/ folder for modular animation controllers.

Cleanup complete:
- Removed CSS keyframe animations (flash, fade)
- Renamed old controllers to .old (CubeFlashController, CubeFadeController)
- Refactored SemantixLogoOrchestrator to use Map-based animation registry
- Added registerAnimation() method for dynamic animation loading
- Updated index.html to remove old animation checkboxes
- Created animations/ folder for new Anime.js-powered controllers
System is now ready for new animation implementations!

Researched Anime.js SVG capabilities:
- morphTo(target, precision): Morph between SVG shapes, precision 0-1 controls interpolation
- createDrawable(target): Animate drawing/revealing paths with 'draw' property ('0 0' to '1 1')
- createMotionPath(path, offset): Move elements along SVG paths with auto-rotation
All return arrays/objects that can be spread into anime() animations
Key insight: These are perfect for our logo - can morph cubes, draw reveals, create motion effects!

Implemented first Anime.js animation - Pulse Wave!
- Created PulseWaveAnimation.js with anime.stagger() for grid-aware sequential delays
- Uses scale [1, 1.15, 1] and opacity [0.75, 1, 0.75] for pulse effect
- Added getAllElements() to CubeGridManager for direct DOM access
- Registered animation dynamically in index.html
- Added UI checkbox to toggle animation
- Grid size changes update animation and call continue() seamlessly
Ready to test!

Session ended with CDN loading issues. 
Status: Architecture complete, PulseWaveAnimation controller built, but anime.es.js not loading from CDN.
Next session TODO: Debug CDN (check network tab), try alternative CDN (unpkg/esm.sh), or consider local anime.js file.
All code is ready - just need working Anime.js import!
